definition: a flash of realization/the truth in a flash/a moment of enlightenment (usually Buddhist)
to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal

sentences.english: What I'm feeling is premature enlightenment.
sentences.chinese: 我的感覺不過是半熟的頓悟。

sentences.english: Probably I should have epiphany before we started it.
sentences.chinese: 可能我應該在開公司之前就有所頓悟的。

sentences.english: That epiphany was the first of two defining experiences in Smarge's Rotary career.
sentences.chinese: 這個頓悟是史馬吉扶輪生涯中兩個決定性的經驗之一。

sentences.english: Finally, realization hit me like a cold splash of water.
sentences.chinese: 最後，我突然頓悟，如同有一瓢冷水潑向了我。

sentences.english: It is here, in this quiet moment, that you have an epiphany.
sentences.chinese: 就是在此時此地，你感受到了靈光頓悟。

sentences.english: I gain new information and insight and deepen my connection with others.
sentences.chinese: 我收穫了新的知識和頓悟，也深化了我與他人的關係。

sentences.english: This split-second epiphany of understanding is rather astonishing.
sentences.chinese: 在那一刻的頓悟是會令你感到非常震撼的。

sentences.english: It's that intuitiveness that makes so-called "epiphany" dreams such a valuable resource.
sentences.chinese: 直覺使得那些所謂“頓悟”的夢成爲寶貴的資源。

sentences.english: It's short or long to life, and insight sooner or later.
sentences.chinese: 生命不在於活得長與短，而在於頓悟的早與晚。

sentences.english: After enlightenment n chop wood, carry water.
Convey anyhow, this should be a kind of satori.
sentences.chinese: 無論如何表達，這都應該算是一種頓悟吧。

sentences.english: Life is not to live long and short, but in the early and late.
sentences.chinese: 生命不在於活得長與短，而在於頓悟的早與晚。

sentences.english: But what the economy required was at odds with a necessary epiphany.
sentences.chinese: 但是經濟所要求的與我們必要的頓悟大相徑庭。

sentences.english: So you don’t tell a soul about your epiphany.
sentences.chinese: 因此你沒有告訴任何人關於靈光頓悟的事。

sentences.english: Han Lei complete satori, the decision is hardheaded be an upright person, begin new life.
sentences.chinese: 韓磊徹底頓悟，決定腳踏實地做人，開始新的人生。

definition: to come to understand/to realize/consciousness/awareness/Buddhist enlightenment (Sanskrit: cittotpāda)
gate to enlightment (Buddhism)/Buddhism/way/method/(old) south gate of a palace
magic transformation performed by Daoist immortal/fig. to reveal/to enlighten
variable/changeable/fickle/impermanence (Sanskrit: anitya)/ghost taking away the soul after death/to pass away/to die
to reincarnate/reincarnation (Buddhism)/(of the seasons etc) to follow each other cyclically/cycle/CL:個|个[ge4]
chance/opportunity/predestined relationship/(Buddhist) principal and secondary causes/chain of cause and effect
actual situation/the ultimate essence of things (Buddhism)
to sense/to perceive/to come to realize/to be aware
